storyInfo: Miss Du and Innkeeper Zheng have a father-daughter falling out, and Master Shen accompanies Lee in pursuit of a mountain-river vista. Taihe comes to probe Liang Xun, but Miss Ning and a mysterious mountain pole-carrier intrude into the office too.

attributes.content: Midday. The skies are clear, as though the heavy rains the night before had been nothing but a lie.
The second tallest of Shangshu's Three Mounts is Mount Juqi. Juqi is home to only two of the Seventeen Peaks, the lesser of which is Nini Peak.
There are twenty two hundred and twenty two steps leading up to Nini Peak. While this may seem like a fascinating coincidence, additional steps were added specifically for the gimmick.
The steps lead heavenward through the clouds. The higher you get, the fewer visitors can be found. A lush, green mountain, rarely ever trodden by footsteps.
A few men can be seen here and there; all of them appear to be pole-carriers on first glance.
This is no Mount T'ien, but truly, what a fine summit.
attributes.name: Teahouse Stopperby

attributes.content: How do you suppose they built a teahouse up here in the mountains, when the roads aren't so much as paved?
attributes.name: Teahouse Stopperby

attributes.content: Hmm. By hand. How else?
attributes.name: Teahouse Tourist

attributes.content: On our way up here, we saw a pole-carrier walking down the mountain, didn't we? They do this every day, carrying anything from foodstuffs to bricks up from the base of the mountain.
attributes.name: Teahouse Tourist

attributes.content: From what I hear, a single trip takes them a good few hours. It's very toilsome work. Even today, some remote mountains still rely on pole-carriers for their survival...
attributes.name: Teahouse Tourist

attributes.content: Can't they build a ropeway for some cable cars or something?
attributes.name: Teahouse Stopperby

attributes.content: First they'd need a plot of land to build it on, wouldn't they?
attributes.name: Teahouse Tourist

attributes.content: Right, not that I know the first thing about building ropeways... Those guys really are amazing, though.
attributes.name: Teahouse Stopperby

attributes.content: They probably rake in quite a bit dough, don't they?
attributes.name: Teahouse Stopperby

attributes.content: Not until recently. I saw on the news not too long ago that the Shangshu magistrate thinks very highly of the coolies. The government's even footing the bill for the teahouses' tea... Uhh?
attributes.name: Teahouse Tourist

attributes.content: Pardon... 'Scuse me.
attributes.name: Pole-Carrier

attributes.content: Noon tea.
attributes.name: Pole-Carrier

attributes.content: You got it, Master Shang.
attributes.name: Teahouse Assistant

attributes.content: Haven't seen you for a couple days. How've you been?
attributes.name: Teahouse Assistant

attributes.content: Same old.
attributes.name: Pole-Carrier

attributes.content: What were you up to?
attributes.name: Teahouse Assistant

attributes.content: Saw my son.
attributes.name: Pole-Carrier

attributes.content: Oh... It's that time again... I'd forgotten.
attributes.name: Teahouse Assistant

attributes.content: If you'd told me sooner, we could've gone together.
attributes.name: Teahouse Assistant

attributes.content: Don't worry about it...
attributes.name: Pole-Carrier

attributes.content: He likes it quiet.
attributes.name: Pole-Carrier

attributes.content: *Sigh*... It's been years now... I'm only saying this because we know each other so well, and I mean no disrespect, but well...
attributes.name: Teahouse Assistant

attributes.content: We can't be stuck in the past.
attributes.name: Teahouse Assistant

attributes.content: You speaking for Zheng Qingyue?
attributes.name: Pole-Carrier

attributes.content: Come on, you know he personally invested in all the teahouses here.
attributes.name: Teahouse Assistant

attributes.content: You're on his payroll. You speak for him. No offense taken.
attributes.name: Pole-Carrier

attributes.content: That's half my own opinion too.
attributes.name: Teahouse Assistant

attributes.content: Half-offended then.
attributes.name: Pole-Carrier

attributes.content: It's been years already. Just hear me out.
attributes.name: Teahouse Assistant

attributes.content: Have some tea and think it through.
attributes.name: Teahouse Assistant

attributes.content: Isn't that the man we saw go down the mountain earlier...?
attributes.name: Teahouse Stopperby

attributes.content: I-I think so? It hasn't been that long, has it? He's back already?
attributes.name: Teahouse Tourist

attributes.content: He and his buddies must have some kind of relay system so he only has to go down halfway. That's the only plausible explanation.
attributes.name: Teahouse Tourist

attributes.content: No good... Can't get through to 'em.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: There's no response, which means Nian and Dusk aren't in Shangshu yet... They might not be following the mission directives.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Benefactor...
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Yeah, I know what you're about to say.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: I'm hardly a clever man, and I certainly can't claim to remember everything I see, but if my eyes did not deceive me...
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: The case that Mr. Lee handed to Mr. Liang... carried the same pattern as the trinket that Nian had.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Must have something to do with them suddenly breaking off from the team.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: What should we do?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Hm... Well, I kind of saw this coming too.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: I talked to Lava, you see. Asked her to contact the Operators near Shangshu and have them come get us as soon as she made it to the office.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Oh? So you came prepared?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Nian was acting awfully dodgy the whole way. I figured she was up to something.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Are you suggesting we stay here for the time being then?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: We bumped into Mr. Lee. Naturally we have to help him. It's in the contract and everything.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: I see. You'll handle this fairly and impartially, while remaining vigilant and conscientious. You continue to command my utmost respect, benefactor.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: But Mr. Lee's a smart man... He never bothered requesting Rhodes Island's assistance ever since we ran into him at the inn. Maybe he's been trying to tell us not to get involved.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: If this really does have to do with Nian, though... Not to mention Taihe and Zuo Le...
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Anyway, we'll check out the rendezvous point when the time comes. Nian's probably gonna be a no-show, but Dusk isn't that kind of girl. We might see her there.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Right. Dusk is likely to drop a hint or two, at least.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: *Sigh*.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: No matter how I slice it, though, sometimes things are just too—
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: —Too coincidental?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Nothing, mate, you didn't have any particular reason for choosing that inn, right?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Oh, you jest. Suppose I had an ulterior motive, how could I have counted on a Gloompincer knocking my car over and then us running into each other?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Then just who is it that made everything line up so perfectly?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Benefactor... that WAS a jest, right? A joke, a jape? You couldn't possibly be suspecting me, could you? Benefactor?!
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Dad.
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: What's the matter...?
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: I thought I was in charge of this whole thing?
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Someone has to clean up the mess.
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: If you can do it, then clearly I could too—
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Wrong.
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: Even if you could, you can't. As long as you're still Du Yaoye and not Du, Head of the Escort Association, there is absolutely no way.
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: Why?!
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Do you still fail to realize why I didn't seize the target when he was at the inn? Why I stopped you, even?
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: It was because of that Cautus with the skills, and that Nothing dude—
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: It seems you still have much to learn.
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: What do you mean...?
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: You have no eye for people.
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: Dad!
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Do you want me to inherit the Association, or do you want me to be the naive Miss Du my whole life?!
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: An escort has many enemies. You don't understand.
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: And so I should continue to be the stupid, ignorant daughter of the Association's head?
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: I'm supposed to let everyone think that Zheng, Head of the Escort Association, is now just an honest businessman, and I'm a successor who's not up to snuff?
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: You know that's not who I am.
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Ye, my girl...
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: Do you know the size of the bone the young people at the Escort Association have to pick with you?
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: What do they know?
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: And what do you know?
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: You're trying to wash your hands of the business, yet you don't even realize how long the younger generation has been unhappy with the current state of the Association.
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Then are you telling me, in all honesty, that starting a new association with those inexperienced disciples is what you truly want?
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: Is that who you are now?
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: All I know is that you made me do this, Dad. And that if I succeed, not only will they all bow down to me, I'll have a fine new addition to my rap sheet.
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: I'm worried that you might not have what it takes.
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: And I'm even more worried that you're actually trying to mess this up.
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: I don't know what you're talking about...
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: If you've changed your mind, then hurry up and tell me. And if you haven't, then...
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Stop worrying about me.
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: How did it go, Miss...? What did the innkeeper say?
attributes.name: Street Youth

attributes.content: Hmph, how do you think it went?
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Zheng got played. They switched it out with a decoy.
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: At least we don't have to screw this one up ourselves. Sounds like he's already on top of it.
attributes.name: Street Youth

attributes.content: Not necessarily.
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: He knows what we're up to.
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: H-Huh?
attributes.name: Street Youth

attributes.content: He knows? What should we do, then? If our masters ground us, we can't do nothing!
attributes.name: Street Youth

attributes.content: Solving a problem like this can take a while, but creating a new one is simple enough.
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: I had this same thought when I first visited Shangshu years ago, but the people here are really quite something.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: From Xinluan to Liuyun, how many wondrous peaks and precipitous paths will we have to cross? The city is dispersed along the mountain chain, and there are settlements scattered all across. What a wondrous sight.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: So... have you come to understand why you came to be robbed?
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: I'm not stupid.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Though I trust Liang Xun, and therefore I trust you, Master Shen.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: *Sigh*... Well, you've got smarts, I'll give you that.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Is that what Liang Xun said about me?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: I came to that conclusion myself. Where does Mr. Liang come into this?
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: He once told me that I put up a front and my predictions never come true, but I have a good eye for people.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: That's what I meant.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: It's all a matter of experience.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Let's go. This is as high as Huntan Peak gets, and we haven't seen any pavilions on our way up here.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Qujiang Peak isn't far from here, but why pick that one? If we're looking for someone, shouldn't we start where more people live?
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: What did they used to call Qujiang?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Zuanjiang Peak. It was difficult to write, so they changed it when it got turned into a tourist spot.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Bingo.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: I had a dream that I was looking for someone on the peak.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Now if that isn't strange... Sure you didn't learn about the old name on your last trip to Shangshu?
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Maybe... Or perhaps...
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: ...I have a mountain spirit guiding me.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: You know how to use Arts, right?
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Think they call 'em Originium Arts now? An inkhorn of a name, I tell you, but they've always been around, and may as well be the gods and spirits you speak of.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Now that's not quite right, Master Shen. It is man who uses Fulu, and thus it is man who triumphs over nature.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: 'It is man who triumphs over nature'?
attributes.name: Lee?

attributes.content: I think I like that saying.
attributes.name: Lee?

attributes.content: Alright, alright. Originium Arts it is. I don't really get these Originium studies... Hm? What are you spacing out for?
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Did I... Did I just say something...?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: 'Man who triumphs over nature'?
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: No...
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Never mind... I was probably daydreaming.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Qujiang Peak... Zuanjiang Peak.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: We looked there numerous times, but the search always came up emptyhanded.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: Naturally.
attributes.name: Taihe

attributes.content: Yet the Sui Regulator has nonetheless come to a decision.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Taihe

attributes.content: Has her presence in Shangshu all these years ever proven to be a transgression, though?
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: Why, then, did she lend Yan her strength, defending her borders dozens of times?
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: Over such a long stretch of time, it certainly defies common sense.
attributes.name: Taihe

attributes.content: But the situation at hand seems to be going against your wishes, Mr. Liang.
attributes.name: Taihe

attributes.content: If she is a shadow, then the goblet from Lungmen must be a flicker of light.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: Did the light come first, or did the shadow? A difficult, yet meaningless question.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: What is truly difficult are the people who try to answer this question.
attributes.name: Taihe

attributes.content: The Sui Regulator came to me directly, to reason with me in person. Naturally, I understand the gravity of the circumstances.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: You promised General Zuo that when the cup arrived in Shangshu, you would feign its theft, allowing it to make its way to his son, Lord Zuo.
attributes.name: Taihe

attributes.content: All to fool certain individuals.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: Correct.
attributes.name: Taihe

attributes.content: Though I couldn't possibly have explained this all to Old Lee, an outsider.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: Then you should not have chosen a Lungmenite to handle this.
attributes.name: Taihe

attributes.content: Given my status, I can't act rashly. It would do more harm than good if it blemishes the early spring festivities.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: And as the magistrate, all matters, both large and small, are of the utmost importance to me.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: Is he not a friend of yours?
attributes.name: Taihe

attributes.content: He is my friend, but he is also an outsider.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: We can hardly blame you, there are too many eyes.
attributes.name: Taihe

attributes.content: What of the cup?
attributes.name: Taihe

attributes.content: As I entrusted my friend with the matter, naturally it is with him.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: You wish to have the Lungmenite uncover Ling's whereabouts without lifting a finger yourself?
attributes.name: Taihe

attributes.content: Correct.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Taihe

attributes.content: Rumor has it that the cup can possess the things around it. Is it true?
attributes.name: Taihe

attributes.content: Mr. Taihe... I have a question myself.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: Please, go ahead.
attributes.name: Taihe

attributes.content: Let us cast aside our status and speak as equals.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: The Sui Regulator bypassed the Ministry of Rites for this matter, far overstepping its bounds. Once the Ministry learns of this, there will likely be quite the quarrel between the two parties.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: You are the Deputy Monitor Censor of the Department of Discipline and Supervision. What are your thoughts?
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: I am indebted to the general, and I am merely repaying the favor.
attributes.name: Taihe

attributes.content: It comes down to personal feelings, then?
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: That is correct.
attributes.name: Taihe

attributes.content: The Department of Discipline and Supervision's Monitor Censor oversees hundreds of officers and champions integrity. It seems to me there should be no place for personal feelings.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: If the Department of Discipline and Supervision learns of this and finds the Ministry of Rites in the right and the Sui Regulator in the wrong, what will become of those personal feelings?
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: Garner loyalty and forsake righteousness.
attributes.name: Taihe

attributes.content: There wasn't even the slightest hesitation in your answer, Mr. Taihe.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: Naturally.
attributes.name: Taihe

attributes.content: It was the general himself who taught me those words.
attributes.name: Taihe

attributes.content: Truly a fine man, then.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: You needn't worry, however.
attributes.name: Taihe

attributes.content: General Zuo is a Yanese soldier. He would never do anything illegal.
attributes.name: Taihe

attributes.content: Did something force the Sui Regulator's hand, then? Even if it means bypassing the Ministry of Rites?
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: Right... Lord Exorcist Zuo Xuanliao is a man who normally gives the affairs in the borderlands his utmost attention. Who could have diverted his attention to a mere goblet?
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: It's no trivial matter, but hardly a significant one either.
attributes.name: Taihe

attributes.content: And I am certain you already know who it is.
attributes.name: Taihe

attributes.content: *sharp exhale*
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: Please take care, Mr. Liang.
attributes.name: Taihe

attributes.content: It seems this spring will be colder than expected.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: Here we are.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Aside from a few houses here and there, this is the only town near Quijiang Peak.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: What kind of place is this?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Before Shangshu City was built, it was near the border. The mountain was full of mineral resources, and many blacksmiths and stonemasons worked here.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: What about now?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: With the world at peace, the nomadic cities are all parked around the mountain range. Aside from the few forges kept around as tourist spots, the town is mostly bed-and-breakfasts now.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: What lies at the top of Qujiang Peak, then...?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: No idea.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Hm... Perhaps just a place for wine and chess?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: After all, if it were scenic, there'd be no need to go look for them. Most likely it's a remote place no one ever visits.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: I know Shangshu's mounts and waters like the back of my hand... Never heard of any pavilions off the beaten path though.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Qujiang Peak has only an empty swath of land. The legend goes that a god, staring into the deep waters there, attained enlightenment by forgetting the waters surrounding it. From then on, everyone called it the 'Field of Forgotten Water.'
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: I see...
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Sounds like our friend won't be easy to find, then... How about we start with the wine shops? Might be futile without knowing what they look like though.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Any ideas, Master Shen?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: When seeking a man, there is this one simple trick that has worked since ancient times.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Have them seek you out instead.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: True, but a little passive for my tastes.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: I have an idea, though—
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Hm...
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Pole-Carrier

attributes.content: Need something?
attributes.name: Pole-Carrier

attributes.content: Miss Ning...
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: Reading for leisure, I see. Fine tastes as always, my lord.
attributes.name: Miss Ning

attributes.content: Reading for leisure enriches the mind.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: If there is something you would like to ask, please go ahead.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: My lord, is something weighing on your mind?
attributes.name: Miss Ning

attributes.content: Hm... What do you mean?
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: Your friend from Lungmen.
attributes.name: Miss Ning

attributes.content: There's no hiding anything from you, Miss Ning. There is a minor matter, though it's entirely personal.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: What does it concern?
attributes.name: Miss Ning

attributes.content: We are looking for someone.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: Hm... What kind of someone?
attributes.name: Miss Ning

attributes.content: An old friend of ours. A practitioner of the martial arts.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: I see. Is that all?
attributes.name: Miss Ning

attributes.content: His name is Huai.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: It seems a simple thing.
attributes.name: Miss Ning

attributes.content: I did say it was a minor matter... You needn't worry.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: You should hide no secrets from me, my lord.
attributes.name: Miss Ning

attributes.content: And I have none to hide.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: Very well, then.
attributes.name: Miss Ning

attributes.content: The lady before him walks across the room and takes a glance at the bookshelf. She appears engulfed in a sense of defeat.
Fortunately, her mood quickly lightens.
It often changes rapidly.
My lord, the book you were reading... Is it a historical record?
attributes.name: Miss Ning

attributes.content: It's about an old Catastrophe that happened within the bounds of Shangshu's Three Mounts.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: You seem to be very fond of that piece of history.
attributes.name: Miss Ning

attributes.content: I saw it with my own eyes. I can never forget it.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: If I remember correctly... 'Tale of the Three Mounts?'
attributes.name: Miss Ning

attributes.content: I'm surprised you remember. It seems I've reread that book far too many times.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: I only happened to notice.
attributes.name: Miss Ning

attributes.content: May I borrow it? I will be paying Uncle Bai a visit. I can read it in my down time.
attributes.name: Miss Ning

attributes.content: As you wish.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: Very well... But...
attributes.name: Miss Ning

attributes.content: Oh, forgive me...
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: Let me get it for you. I haven't been able to read it much lately, so I placed it fairly high on the shelf.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Miss Ning

attributes.content: So you'll be visiting Bai, the potter?
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Miss Ning

attributes.content: Please give him my regards.
attributes.name: Liang Xun

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Miss Ning

attributes.content: I will take my leave now.
attributes.name: Miss Ning

attributes.content: 'Tale of the Three Mounts...'
attributes.name: Miss Ning

attributes.content: My lord, I am sure you never realized, but I have actually already taken a peek at your bookshelf, once when you worked late into the night and fell asleep in your study.
attributes.name: Miss Ning

attributes.content: (He's never put this book so high up...)
attributes.name: Miss Ning

attributes.content: (There was a new case on the shelf too... What could be inside?)
attributes.name: Miss Ning
